companyName: Company is a leading solution provider for air conditioning and refrigeration products in India, with a strong presence across the entire value chain of Room Air Conditioners (RAC)
description: Company is a leading solution provider for air conditioning and refrigeration products in India, with a strong presence across the entire value chain of Room Air Conditioners (RAC). Established in 1990, the company has evolved into a key player in the Indian OEM/ODM space, catering to major brands in the consumer durables industry.
keyGrowthTriggers: Company operates across 3 divisions, with Q2FY26 revenue contribution of 53% from the Consumer Durable Division, 39% from the Electronics Division, and 8% from the Railway Subsystems & Mobility Division.

Consumer Durable Division: Company has 24 facilities under the Consumer Durable Division with 70% BoM catering capability, serving RAC, CAC, and components. Company expects industry growth driven by the GST reduction on RACs from 28% to 18% and aims to outperform the industry by 13–15% for the year.

Electronics Division: Company operates 6 facilities and expanding at Hosur with a planned investment of INR 991 Cr, targeting trial production by Q2FY27. The Ascent-K Circuit JV will focus on HDI, Flex, and semiconductor substrate PCBs with a LoI received for 16 acres in Jewar, pending state approval. Company is also expanding PCB assembly capacity in Pune and expects operating EBITDA margins to reach double digits by FY27.

Railways & Defense division: Operates 1 facility division (Sidwal) and is adding 2 more, backed by INR 2,600+ Cr order book & visibility with another INR 400–500 Cr expected soon. The Sidwal greenfield facility will begin trial operations in Q3FY26 and commercial production in Q4FY26, while the Yujin JV facility is ready with commercial production expected in H1FY27. Management has reaffirmed guidance to double the division’s revenue over the next 2 years with Vande Bharat deliveries largely from next year onward.

quarterlyResults.rawText: **29th Jul 2025:** (GOOD RESULTS) For the quarter ending Jun-25, Sales up 44% YoY from INR 2,401 Cr in Jun-24 to INR 3,449 Cr in Jun-25. Similarly, Net Profit up 41% from INR 75 Cr to INR 106 Cr. On a QoQ basis, Sales down 8% and Net Profit down 10

**27th May 2025:** (EXCELLENT RESULTS) For the quarter ending Mar-25, Sales up 34% YoY from INR 2,805 Cr in Mar-24 to INR 3,754 Cr in Mar-25. Similarly, Net Profit up 19% from INR 99 Cr to INR 118 Cr. On a QoQ basis, Sales up 76% and Net Profit up 3.2x.

dealActivity.description: (GOOD RESULTS) For the quarter ending Dec-25, Sales up 38% YoY from INR 2,133 Cr in Dec-24 to INR 2,943 Cr in Dec-25. Over the same period, Operating Profit Margin increased from 7% to 8%. Similarly, Net Profit up 70% from INR 37 Cr to INR 63 Cr (adjust for Exceptional). Comparison on a QoQ basis not valid.

Company has been allotted 100 acres of land by Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) at Sector 8, near Jewar Airport, for setting up a new manufacturing facility. Additionally, Company’s material subsidiary Ascent-K Circuit Private Limited has been allotted 16 acres at Sector 10, YEIDA, for a separate manufacturing unit. The combined proposed investment is INR 6,785 Cr, to be deployed over the investment scheme period, and is expected to generate over 3,000 direct jobs in a phased manner.

ICRA has reaffirmed Company’s Long-term rating to ICRA\] AA \- (Stable) with total rated limits increased to INR 2,165 Cr from INR 765 Cr citing its leadership in RAC ODM, deep backward integration, diversified and growing electronics portfolio, strong OEM relationships, and a strengthened balance sheet supported by recent equity raises and strategic acquisitions.

Company’s subsidiary IL JIN Electronics (India) Pvt Ltd has completed the acquisition of an 80% stake in Shogini Technoarts Pvt Ltd for about INR 506 Cr, making Shogini a subsidiary of IL JIN and a step-down subsidiary of Amber.

Company’s material subsidiary IL JIN Electronics has acquired 1.4 L shares at NIS 24.59 per share, totaling NIS 3.32 million of Unitronics via ILJIN Holding, its wholly owned Israel-based arm. With this IL JIN now controls 41.2% of Unitronics.

Company’s material subsidiary IL JIN Electronics signed a definitive agreement to acquire a majority stake in Shogini Technoarts, a Pune-based PCB maker with FY25 revenue of about INR 390 Cr. Shogini builds single, double, multilayer, metal and flexible PCBs and has been around since 1982\. The deal, funded in cash and closed in tranches after conditions precedent, will make Shogini a subsidiary of IL JIN and a step-down subsidiary of Amber.

(POOR RESULTS) For the quarter ending Sep-25, Sales down 2% YoY from INR 1685 Cr in Sep-24 to INR 1647 Cr in Sep-25. Similarly, Net Profit down from INR 21 Cr to a loss INR \-32 Cr. On a QoQ basis, Sales down 52% and company moved from a profit of INR 106 Cr to a loss of INR \-32 Cr.

Company’s material subsidiary IL JIN Electronics (India) Pvt Ltd has completed the acquisition of a 40.20% controlling stake in Unitronics (1989) (R"G) Ltd for a consideration of NIS 156.08 million. Of this, FIMI Opportunity V funds sold 31.34% and Mr. Haim Shani sold 8.86% of Unitronics’ equity. Unitronics has become a step-down subsidiary of Amber Enterprises, strengthening its global footprint and capabilities in industrial automation and smart manufacturing solutions.

Company’s material subsidiary ILJIN Electronics (India) executed definitive agreements to raise INR 550 Cr via issue of 8.5 L Compulsorily Convertible Preference Shares (CCPS) to marquee investors including Singularity Equity Fund, Axis New Opportunities AIF, Nuvama Crossover Funds, Motilal Oswal Finvest, Avendus Future Leaders Fund, InCred Wealth, and Frangipani Capital. Funds will support organic and inorganic growth of Company’s electronics segment, with CCPS conversion at mutually agreed price. Company’s holding in ILJIN (currently 90.2%) will reduce post conversion.
Company has closed its QIP raising INR 1,000 Cr through allotment of 12.6 L shares at INR 7,950/share to qualified institutional buyers.

Company’s Material subsidiary IL JIN Electronics India Pvt Ltd has acquired 100% equity in ILJIN Holding Ltd, Israel, for cash consideration (100 ordinary shares of par value 1 NIS each) to establish a SPV for ILJIN’s strategic international investments and acquisitions.

Company’s material subsidiary “ILJIN Electronics (India) Pvt Ltd” has raised INR 1,200 Cr in its first institutional round, led by ChrysCapital with INR 1,100 Cr and InCred Growth Partners Fund I with INR 100 crore through equity and CCPS. The funds will be used to scale operations, enhance manufacturing, and pursue targeted acquisitions in electronics manufacturing, aligning with India’s PLI and ECMS schemes.

(GOOD RESULTS) For the quarter ending Jun-25, Sales up 44% YoY from INR 2,401 Cr in Jun-24 to INR 3,449 Cr in Jun-25. Similarly, Net Profit up 41% from INR 75 Cr to INR 106 Cr. On a QoQ basis, Sales down 8% and Net Profit down 10%.

Amber’s subsidiary ILJIN Electronics to acquire 40.2% stake in Israel-based Unitronics for NIS 156 Mn (approx. INR 403 Cr) gaining joint control with Mr. Haim Shani (45.13%). Unitronics is listed on TASE and specializes in PLCs, HMIs, IIoT, and Industry 4.0 automation solutions. Acquisition aligns with Company’s strategy to expand industrial automation capabilities and global footprint.

Company’s Board has approved resolution to raise up to INR 2,500 Cr through issuance of permissible securities, subject to shareholder approval in the upcoming 35th AGM scheduled for August 11, 2025\.

Amber Group via subsidiary "IL JIN Electronics India Pvt Ltd " to acquire majority stake in One Micro Systems Pvt Ltd \- a leading player in Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS), solar inverters (on-grid, off-grid, and hybrid), EV chargers, and UPS systems. This acquisition aligns with Amber’s strategy to expand into energy solution sector.

(EXCELLENT RESULTS) For the quarter ending Mar-25, Sales up 34% YoY from INR 2,805 Cr in Mar-24 to INR 3,754 Cr in Mar-25. Similarly, Net Profit up 19% from INR 99 Cr to INR 118 Cr. On a QoQ basis, Sales up 76% and Net Profit up 3.2x.

points: Company has secured funding at both the holding and subsidiary levels, including a ₹1,000 crore QIP at Amber and ₹1,750 crore CCPS/equity infusion at ILJIN Electronics (₹650 crore received; ₹1,100 crore pending CCI approval). Company targets becoming cash positive by year-end with H2 net interest cost of ₹20–25 crore. 2\. Company expects the RAC industry to grow from 15 million units to 30–35 million units by FY30, supported by the GST reduction, and intends to maintain its 27% manufacturing footprint. 3\. Company, through its Railways & Defense division (Sidwal), has an order book visibility of ₹2,600+ crore, with another ₹400–500 crore expected soon. Company has reaffirmed guidance to double the division’s revenue over the next two financial years, with Vande Bharat deliveries expected largely from next year onward.
